Why turn California sideways in a prototype viz?

1. Never done it before
2. Not for a client so there's no rules
3. California is wide and so is my screen
4. Easy to do
5. Possibly innovation
6. Makes it look different from other maps of the same data
7. Fun https://t.co/F8Jlb3632A

Sorry, I know its already a timelapse in the scrubber, I meant pulling as .pngs and run through after effects frame blending, which would enhance the abstract art aspect

I LOVE the abstract art, this is really awesome work! (Should find some more pleasant data to fill it with and keep it as is) ‚Äì also would love to see this with a timelapse üòâ @enjalot https://t.co/nj2zUXlpzb

but if you are finding yourself in a place where contributing to an open source project that helps data journalists ensure the integrity of their data could help you, either through practice or for your portfolio or for the intrinsic reward, Dataproofer could use some affection

also super shoutouts to @newsroomdev for creating and literally paying the bills on an awesome open source tool, I will only speak for myself but it's been hard for me to balance open source stuff with full-time work for the past year, things have been, I would say, weird

sometimes you wake up to a question that requires you to look deeply within yourself and be honest - also, totally unrelated, anyone feel motivated to kick off some momentum for Dataproofer in 2020? https://t.co/QblElNZ84R
